abstract: Updated: Alan Schwartz, the former chief executive of Bear Stearns, has decided not to stay at JPMorgan Chase, which bought Bear in March in an emergency deal that stunned Wall Street.
lead_paragraph: Updated: Alan Schwartz, the former chief executive of Bear Stearns, has decided not to stay at JPMorgan Chase, which bought Bear in March in an emergency deal that stunned Wall Street.

headline.main: Former Bear Chief to Leave JPMorgan

abstract: Now that Alan D. Schwartz’s impending departure from JPMorgan Chase is confirmed, the next question that arises is this: Where will he go next?
lead_paragraph: Now that Alan D. Schwartz’s impending departure from JPMorgan Chase is confirmed, the next question that arises is this: Where will he go next?

headline.main: What’s Next for Bear’s Former Chief?

abstract: Which financial firms are primed to fare well as the markets continue to tremble? According to Fidelity Investments‘ flagship Magellan fund, they’re Goldman Sachs and the American International Group.
lead_paragraph: Which financial firms are primed to fare well as the markets continue to tremble? According to Fidelity Investments‘ flagship Magellan fund, they’re Goldman Sachs and the American International Group.

headline.main: Fidelity Shows Its Hand on Goldman, Citi, JPMorgan
